data.title: Green "+" not showing added node on animation dialog
data.body:
When I attempt to add a node on the dialog that appears when you select an animation player, nothing shows until I fiddle about with timeline, settings and changing animations back and forth.

This should be replicated by adding a function call animation track and attempting to add a node to that track.

I am using the latest fixnum Linux build of Godot, which can be downloaded here: http://fixnum.org/godot/

![selection_091](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8548727/12222876/019b9f28-b7c0-11e5-851a-dd6bed7bd035.png)

data.title: YSort node not sorting GUI items
data.body:
Hi! 
I've stumbled upon the problem that YSort node sorts only visually the nodes, but GUI items keep their tree order. It would be great if GUI items would also be affected by YSort node.
![texturebtn](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9309589/12222626/7506c8c2-b7b9-11e5-823a-94810c70ed7d.jpg)
In a preview you can see that sprites are y sorted. The red dot is the area user clicked- normally the house that is in front should be highlighted, but since the Texture button isn't y sorted, the house that's behind highlights.

data.title: Animation Player with Opacity
data.body:
As of build 3a3ce982b0157c21b4976a347d4c1c254093970f - the animation player involving with opacity does not behave correctly. When you key opacity at 0, 1, then 0 - when you play the animation player in the editor, it does show the intended behavior. However, when you run the scene or play the game, it does not fades in (from 0 to 1) then fades out (from 1 to 0), instead it just pops in and out as if the code show() and hide() are being executed.

I've attached a project showcasing this issue since it's difficult to show it through screenshot:
[AnimationPlayer-Opacity.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/84103/AnimationPlayer-Opacity.zip)

data.title: export.cfg can't be saved
data.body:
1. Open any project.
2. Open **Project Export Settings**
3. change value of `Android > Package > Unique Name`
   - `org.godotengine.$genname` to `org.godotengine.test`
4. restart editor and open it again
5. Try to change any property.

then console says

```
ERROR: close: Condition ' rename_error ' is true.
   At: drivers/windows/file_access_windows.cpp:133
```

And all changes are gone when reopen project.(restart editor)
tested with latest commit 3a3ce982b0157c21b4976a347d4c1c254093970f

edit : added more specific steps to reproduce.

data.title: Polygon2D & wierd texture bugs
data.body:
Hi!
I noticed this bug some time ago on my "older" android phone (a Sony Xperia St21a).

Everytime there's a Polygon2D on the scene, some textures gets corrupted or are missing.
I first noticed this when using a Polygon2D as a background. The Sprite nodes in front of it were not displayed.

Here's a more recent example:

The level has a tilemap, some sprites and a Polygon2D as the cave background. This is my level on editor:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/12219055/3873eed8-b711-11e5-9783-af5ef83d665d.png)

And this is the level running on desktop:
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/12219057/4a246478-b711-11e5-804c-0579d91e1255.png)

Then, I run the game on my ST21a and this is the result:
![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/12219059/5b9ca24c-b711-11e5-8c49-aead97b67a67.png)

As you can see the tiles are pixelated. At first I tried disabling the mipmaping and see if that helped, but no. Then I remembered the issue I'm describing with the Polygon2D node. So I removed the node from the scene tree and this is the result:
![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/12219066/b755e2e2-b711-11e5-9300-716afb04cdbc.png)

As you can see now the mipmap is working right and all the sprites are displayed correctly.

The device info:
![datos](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/12219097/5b8976b6-b713-11e5-8722-7ac1f3e8b76d.png)

On more recent devices the game looks fine. I don't know what might be causing this bugs. Maybe there's a memory/texture pointers limit that's being overflowed? 
Here's also a hint: the issue is fixed if the polygon is assigned with a texture.

data.title: FileAccessUnix::_get_modified_time error
data.body:
On OpenSUSE Linux, when I open any project, I get the following error for every resource/file in the project:

```
ERROR IN: /new_scene.tscn
ERROR: _get_modified_time: Method/Function Failed, returning: 0
   At: drivers/unix/file_access_unix.cpp:236.
```

Looking at that function, the error means that the Unix stat() call is returning an error. No idea if the problem is with Godot or with my system... any way I can get additional info on the error?
Otherwise, it doesn't crash Godot or anything, so I haven't had to do anything about it.

Still happening on 662ed9c. This is not a very new issue for me, but I'm not sure when it started.

data.title: Android Export issue: jarsigner error #1, export.cpp warnings
data.body:
Hi!
First of all, the installation of both godot and the android requirements went great, the guide is clear.

Then, I was able to produce and apk, but it doesn't work because of these errors.

First, jarsigner error #1, which was resolved in another issue by deleting META-INF from the apk. However I didn't find any META-INF.

In fact, this problem is probably caused by a bunch of export.cpp errors.
Whenever I try to export to Android, the program outputs these:
- platform/android/export/export.cpp:854 - Screen res name in a resource, should be plaintext
  [4 times]

and then
- platform/android/export/export.cpp:799 - Application name in a resource, should be plaintext (but you can ignore this).
- platform/android/export/export.cpp:810 - Activity name in a resource, should be plaintext (but you can ignore this)

I tried it on a almost plain project of mine and on the "Area 2D input events" demo project.

So, am I missing somthing?
I'm using Ubuntu Studio 14.04, tried both Godot 1.1 and the last Alpha of 2.0 (the errors are the same)
Using Openjdk 6 from ubuntu repositories.

Thanks in advance!

data.title: Fix build (pthread renaming) on Open/FreeBSD
data.body:
- declared in `pthread_np.h`
- written with underscore `pthread_set_name_np`
- does not return:
  
  > Because of the debugging nature of this function,
  > all errors that may appear inside are silently ignored.
  >   https://www.freebsd.org/cgi/man.cgi?query=pthread_set_name_np&sektion=3

data.title: Ability for the game window to "request attention"
data.body:
The ability for the game window to "request attention" (blink the tray icon on Windows and GNU/Linux, bounce the dock icon in OS X) would be useful for many things, especially when the game is minimized or unfocused.

Use cases:
- Chat message has arrived
- A player joined/left the game (for multiplayer games)
- …

Just like in LOVE: https://love2d.org/wiki/love.window.requestAttention

---

**Implemented for the following platforms:**
- [x] Windows (#5560)
- [x] OSX (#5662)
- [x] Linux (#5842)
- [ ] Haiku

data.title: Fix maven repositories bug
data.body: If a dependency added to gradle dependencies, previous gradle template cause build to be failed. This fixes second bug reported by @volzhs at #3285.

data.title: Parameter for ready() to indicate if it's called for the first time
data.body:
Currently `_ready()` is called every time the node enters scene tree. 
People tend to use _ready as a constructor, but in some situations it can be harmful since sometimes there is need to reparent node or disable it (by removing it from the scene tree for some time).
My proposition is to add additional boolean parameter to `_on_ready` that will indicate if this is a first ready call for given node.  

Potentially related issue: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1905

data.body:
Fixed small errors shown by terminal warnings since 3d0bd1a:

```

ERROR: emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'selection_changed': 'SpatialEditor::_update_selection': Method not found.

```

data.title: Remove replacing of question marks from String::c_escape/c_unescape
data.body:
Closes #3283 

Because C/C++ string should continue to work even with the question mark unescaped, I think this wouldn't case a regression. (plus, if the old behaviour is required, one can simply do `string.c_escape().replace("\?", "\\\?")`)

~~Will test soon.~~ Tested, works just fine.

data.title: Add Point2i type for integer coordinates (like in TileMap)
data.body:
GDScript only has float vector structs (Vector2/Vector3), no integer versions, so functions like `TileMap::get_used_cells` convert their integer cell coordinates to `Vector2`s. If they're left as `Vector2`s when we do calculations on them, like adding/subtracting to get adjacent cells, the floating-point math [could introduce small error](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floating_point#Accuracy_problems), and using the `Vector2` variable in certain ways will create bugs:
- As keys in a Dictionary, since the hashes will be different and `==` will return false
- Cast back to `int`s for the other TileMap functions, since the fractional part gets truncated, not rounded (example in GDScript: `int(1.9999999)` returns 1, not 2.)

I'm avoiding the issue by converting the coordinates to Arrays `[int(vector.x), int(vector.y)]` before using them in my pathfinding/line-of-sight functions or the Dictionary where I keep extra map info. But it'd be more convenient and efficient to have an integer vector struct that works like `Vector2`, so I made a branch implementing the existing `Point2i` type from [math_2d.h](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/math/math_2d.h#L369) into GDScript, Variant, the resource formats, and those TileMap functions: https://github.com/sheepandshepherd/godot/tree/point2i
And a scene testing that the new type, operators, saving/loading, etc all work correctly: https://github.com/sheepandshepherd/godot-point2i-test

Are these integer vector types something we'd want to add to Godot? If so, I can finish adding Point2iArray and Point3i types, then make a pull request. Or otherwise, I don't mind just sticking with IntArrays, which are a simpler solution to the problem; might not warrant adding new types to GDScript.

data.title: to_json()   ?-character
Fix debugger close button and script editor "Show Debugger"
data.body:
Now the script debugger will close when pressing the close button, and the script editor "Show Debugger" will be checked when the debugger show up. This way the debugger can be easily closed when using the "Keep Debugger Open" option.

And fixed a small typo.

data.title: YSort companion node
data.body:
**_Disclaimer**_ : I am not asking for YSort to sort all sub-nodes of it's child nodes. 

Would it be possible to add a new node that would only serve as a container/symbolic link within YSort nodes, where its contents would be YSorted as if they were direct children of the YSort node for better organization?

I'm not asking for this to interfere with other nodes or instanced nodes that are already children of the YSort node. They should all work the same way as before.

**_example**_

YSort1

> > **_sprite1**_ <---- YSorted because it is a direct child node of the YSort node
> > **_instanced nodes**_ <---- would still get sorted like they currently already do just like sprites 1-2(and its children would **_not**_ be sorted)
> > **_sprite2**_
> > (**_New node**_)
> > 
> > > > **_sprite3**_
> > > > **_sprite4**_ <---- Direct children of the new node (sprite3 and 4) would be YSorted as if they were direct children of the YSort1 node like sprites 1-2

I apologise for resubmitting this issue. I submitted it two days ago https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3258 but it was closed because everyone thought I was asking to sort **_all**_ sub-nodes of children of YSort nodes.
